alert.note: Alert for Ferry; Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 28 at 2:20PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northeast Washington, including the following counties, in North Central Washington, Okanogan. In Northeast Washington, Ferry. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. Debris flows are also possible in steep terrain, especially recent burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms Tuesday afternoon and evening will have the potential to produce heavy rain. Then steady moderate to locally heavy rain Tuesday Night into Wednesday morning will lead to continued potential flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
